SEARCH
Package sh.brane.core

Class RevertDecoder

java.lang.Object
sh.brane.core.RevertDecoder
public final class RevertDecoder extends Object
Decodes EVM revert reasons from raw transaction revert data.

When a smart contract reverts, the EVM returns hex-encoded revert data. This class decodes that data into human-readable revert reasons and categorizes the revert type.

Revert Types:

  • ERROR_STRING: Standard Error(string) revert with message
    • Selector: 0x08c379a0
    • Triggered by: revert("reason"), require(false, "reason")
    • Example: "Insufficient balance"
  • PANIC: Solidity Panic(uint256) with error code
    • Selector: 0x4e487b71
    • Triggered by: assert(false), division by zero, array out of bounds
    • Codes: 0x01=assert, 0x11=overflow, 0x12=div by zero, 0x32=array bounds, etc.
  • CUSTOM: Solidity custom errors (defined with error keyword)
    • More gas-efficient than string reverts
    • Can include typed parameters
    • Example: error InsufficientBalance(uint256 available, uint256 required);
  • UNKNOWN: Unrecognized revert data format

Usage Example: 


 try {
     client.sendTransactionAndWait(request);
 } catch (RevertException e) {
     RevertDecoder.Decoded decoded = RevertDecoder.decode(e.rawDataHex());

     switch (decoded.kind()) {
         case ERROR_STRING ->
             System.err.println("Reverted: " + decoded.reason());
         case PANIC ->
             System.err.println("Panic code: " + decoded.reason());
         case CUSTOM ->
             System.err.println("Custom error: " + decoded.reason());
     }
 }

  • Method Details

    • decode

      public static RevertDecoder.Decoded decode(String rawDataHex)
      Decodes a revert reason from raw hex data.
      Parameters:
      rawDataHex - the raw hex string returned by the node (e.g. "0x...")
      Returns:
      the decoded result, or RevertDecoder.RevertKind.UNKNOWN if decoding fails

    • decode

      public static RevertDecoder.Decoded decode(String rawDataHex, Map<String,RevertDecoder.CustomErrorAbi> customErrors)
      Decodes a revert reason using a set of known custom error ABIs.
      Parameters:
      rawDataHex - the raw hex string
      customErrors - a map of 4-byte selectors (without "0x") to error definitions
      Returns:
      the decoded result

    • throwIfRevert

      public static void throwIfRevert(RpcException e) throws RevertException
      Checks if an RpcException contains revert data and throws a RevertException if so.

      This method inspects the exception's data field. If it contains valid revert data (starts with "0x" and has sufficient length for a selector), it decodes the revert reason and throws a RevertException.

      Parameters:
      e - the RpcException to check
      Throws:
      RevertException - if the exception contains decodable revert data
